results.title: Multinationals (NP)
results.creator_credit: Ashley Schwall-Kearney, Monash University, Open Learning Agency of Australia and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “The Global Economy”.
This episode of “The Global Economy” examines the contemporary workings of multinational companies. Using Hungary as a test-case, we examine how a developing nation’s economy is affected once it is reliant upon international capital. The question of whether multinational corporations can be said to have a national “home” or whether they now are part of an international economy with no strict state borders is also addressed. A panel of economists from Europe, the United States and Australia discuss some of the issues affecting the politics of transglobal industries in the post-Cold War global culture.

results.title: Multimedia: opportunities for Australia
results.creator_credit: Ben Cardillo, Film Australia and Laura Zusters
results.brief_description: A forum in which members of the Australian multimedia industry discuss opportunities and issues affecting the development of their industry. This program will be helpful for companies, policy makers, educational institutions and industry analysts wishing to gain an overview of those in the Australian small business community developing multimedia products.

results.title: Multimedia Stravinsky: the rite of spring (PC)
results.brief_description: This is an insightful multimedia exploration of Stravinsky’s passionate composition. Explore the ballet, the music and the cultural milieu that gave birth to Stravinky’s art. SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS: A multimedia PC with 386SX or higher miscroprocessor, 2MB of RAM, 30-MB hard disk, CD-ROM drive, audio board, VGA display, Microsoft Windows operating system (3.1 or later), MS-DOS operating system version 3.1 or later.

results.title: Multimedia Strauss: three tone poems (PC)
results.brief_description: Welcome to Multimedia Strauss. You will discover the beauty of three of Richard Strauss’ most popular - and powerful - tone poems. SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS: To hear the music and narration and to display the graphics and text you need: a multimedia PC that includes a 386SX or higher processor, 4MB of RAM, 5MB free hard disk space, CD-ROM drive, audio board capable of playing ADPCM compressed audio, mouse, and VGA or VGA+ display capable of displaying 256 colors or an equivalent PC with Multimedia upgrade kit. MS-DOS operating system version 3.1 or later. Microsoft Windows operating system 3.1. MS-DOS CD-ROM Extensions (MSCDEX) version 2.2 or later. Multimedia Strauss can also be played as an audio compact disc.

results.title: Multimedia Mozart: the dissonant quartet (PC)
results.brief_description: The Dissonant Quartet is an elucidating, captivating exploration of the man and his music, from the emotional dynamics of the String Quartet in C Major, to the historic events in his world, to the expressive beauty of the individual stringed instruments. Experience the power of Mozart’s artistry and the intensity of his genius. SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS: a multimedia PC or compatible with 386SX or higher microprocessor, 2MB of RAM, 30MB of hard-disk, CDROM -drive, audio board and VGA display. Microsoft Windows and MS-DOS operating system, versions 3.1 or later.

results.title: Multimedia Beethoven: the ninth symphony (PC)
results.brief_description: The Ninth Symphony will arouse your senses, stir your imagination and change forever the way you experience music. The composer’s life is examined along with the cultural, social and political events which influenced him, and the musical composition are considered also as components of the Ninth Symphony are broken down and analysed. SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS: A multimedia PC or compatiblewith a 386SX microprocessor, 4.5 MB of memory, at least 4MB of hard-disk space, CDROM drive, audio board, and VGA+ monitor. MS-DOS operating system and Microsoft Windows, versions 3.1 or later,

results.title: Multicultural education: a teaching style
results.creator_credit: Media Five Film, David Arnold, Dennis Hicks and Wayne Threm
results.brief_description: Looks at the change from the traditional “melting pot” theory to an appreciation of cultural pluralism. Several classroom approaches are demonstrated which encourage ethnic groups to maintain their identity and pride and at the same time learn mutual respect. Suitable for teacher/tertiary level.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Media Five Film, David Arnold, Dennis Hicks and Wayne Threm
